private_information: I am the left peg and I currently hold disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H where A is smallest and H is largest.
left_peg.goal: Achieve the final configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

private_information: I am the middle peg and I currently hold no disks.
middle_peg.goal: Achieve the final configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

private_information: I am the right peg and I currently hold no disks.
right_peg.goal: Achieve the final configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the peg agents to produce a single PDDL domain and problem file that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance with 8 disks, suitable for the FastDownward solver, achieving the final configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A through H where A is the smallest and H is the largest.
Initially the left peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. The middle and right pegs are empty.
The goal is to move all disks so that the right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H and the left and middle pegs are empty.
Rules: move one disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.

analysis.system_prompt: You represent the left peg. Your task is to describe your local state and the legal single-disk moves you can perform or propose from your perspective. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on precise facts useful to an orchestrator, such as which disk is on top, which moves are immediately legal, and any constraints you observe.
analysis.prompt: Agent name: left_peg. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private information. Provide a concise description of your local state, list the disk currently on top, enumerate all legal single-disk moves available to you right now (for example move top disk from left to middle or left to right if legal), and state any assumptions or ambiguities that the orchestrator should resolve. Do not output PDDL or domain/problem files.

analysis.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg. Your task is to describe your local state and the legal single-disk moves you can perform or accept. Do not produce PDDL. Provide clear facts for the orchestrator about which moves are currently legal onto or from your peg.
analysis.prompt: Agent name: middle_peg. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private information. Provide a concise description of your local state, indicate that you are empty or list your top disk if any, enumerate legal single-disk moves that involve your peg as source or destination, and note any assumptions or constraints. Do not output PDDL or domain/problem files.

analysis.system_prompt: You represent the right peg. Your task is to describe your local state and the legal single-disk moves you can perform or accept. Do not produce PDDL. Provide concise facts that the orchestrator can use to build a global plan.
analysis.prompt: Agent name: right_peg. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private information. Provide a concise description of your local state, list the top disk if any, enumerate legal single-disk moves that involve your peg, and flag any constraints or ambiguities. Do not output PDDL or domain/problem files.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your job is to integrate the local analyses from the peg agents and produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that fully specify the Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownward solver. The PDDL must model pegs left, middle, and right and disks A through H, enforce the rule that only the top disk of a peg can be moved and that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk, and allow only one disk move at a time. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward planner by using a standard PDDL subset compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You receive the analyses from the three peg agents. Integrate their information, resolve any minor ambiguities they reported, and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi with pegs left, middle, and right. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward and includes clear typing or predicates to represent disk sizes, which disk is on which peg and which disk is immediately above another, and an action schema to move a top disk from one peg to another with appropriate preconditions and effects. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Output only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the specified tags when you run.
